ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: It helped me learn how to read ancient sources and to write about them. I learned a lot about emotions throughout history and have definitely been able to apply that to my own life. It also was a great example of a seminar where everyone participates and it feels like a safe space.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed this course! It is one of my favorite classes so far at Yale! It really allows students to think about their emotions and how they interact with them. I think this course should stay exactly the way it is.

Strong seminar -- sometimes courses cannot sustain conversation for the entire length of the seminar but that was never the case here. The ideas and readings were interesting and varied, and the isntructor was great at parsing out big conflicts and ideas in our conversation so that we could organically respond and keep learning throughout class time.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It was a wonderful course that required introspection and reflection, both aspects that I really enjoyed.

Definitely! I am not a classics or religion major, but this course helped me learn about those subjects in a way that was applicable to my own interests. It was a perfect storm of studying history, classics, religion, anthropology and cognitive science in order to understand emotions and all sorts of topics surrounding emotions. If you are looking for an interesting seminar to learn something new, this is for you. The readings are interesting and the assignments are super reasonable.
